meanings.definition: The act of applying force or influence on someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: Her constant pressuring made him feel overwhelmed.
meanings.sent2: The pressuring from his boss to meet deadlines was intense.
meanings.sent3: The pressuring from his friends to join them for a night out was relentless.
meanings.sent4: The pressuring from the media to conform to beauty standards can be suffocating.
meanings.sent5: The pressuring to make a decision quickly felt like a weight on his shoulders.

meanings.definition: The feeling of stress or urgency caused by external factors.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't handle the pressuring from work and family responsibilities.
meanings.sent2: The pressuring to finish the project on time was causing him anxiety.
meanings.sent3: The pressuring to choose the right outfit for the party was comical.
meanings.sent4: The pressuring to excel in sports felt like a race against time.
meanings.sent5: The pressuring to perform well in exams was like a cloud hanging over her head.
